Dear [Patient's Name],

I am writing to summarize your recent hospital stay from February 10th to February 14th, 2024, during which you were admitted under the care of Dr. ___. You presented with symptoms of cough, shortness of breath, hemoptysis, and fever, and were diagnosed with lobar pneumonia caused by an unspecified organism.

On admission, your chest X-Ray showed consolidation in the left lower lobe. Initial laboratory tests indicated elevated inflammatory markers, including a C-reactive protein (CRP) level of 60 mg/L and a white blood cell (WBC) count of 12 x10^9/L. These findings, together with your clinical presentation, confirmed the diagnosis of pneumonia. You were treated with intravenous Amoxicillin at a dosage of 500 mg every 8 hours, along with supportive medications such as Paracetamol as needed to manage fever and discomfort.

During your stay, your condition showed significant improvement. By February 11th, your CRP had decreased to 50 mg/L, and your WBC count was 11 x10^9/L. Your vital signs stabilized, with your temperature normalizing and oxygen saturation increasing progressively—reaching 98% by February 13th. On February 12th, with your condition stabilized, we transitioned your antibiotics to oral administration.

By the day of discharge, you showed continued clinical improvement. Your CRP levels had reduced further to 20 mg/L, and your WBC count returned to near-normal levels at 7 x10^9/L. You were deemed medically fit for discharge, and we provided prescriptions for oral antibiotics to continue at home for five more days.

You are advised to follow up at our outpatient clinic in two weeks for further assessment and to ensure full recovery. Please monitor for any signs of recurrence or adverse effects and contact your primary care physician if any concerns arise before your scheduled follow-up.

It was a pleasure to care for you, and I am pleased with the progress you have made. If you have any questions or need further assistance regarding your care after discharge, do not hesitate to contact our office.

Wishing you continued health and recovery.

Sincerely,

Dr. ___
